to shed; to take off; to escape; to get away from
пролить; взлететь; Сбежать; убежать от

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 脱)
Antonyms: 穿
Pictophonetic: 兌 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
脫離 [ tuō lí ]: to separate oneself from; to break away from; diastasis (medicine); abscission; abjunction (botany)
脫貧致富 [ tuō pín zhì fù ]: to rise from poverty and become prosperous (idiom); poverty alleviation
脫穎而出 [ tuō yǐng ér chū ]: to reveal one's talent (idiom); to rise above others; to distinguish oneself
脫貧 [ tuō pín ]: to lift oneself out of poverty

    • 兌 [ duì ] cash, check; to exchange

Ru_trainchinese:
tuō: (глаг/нареч/союз) снимать; (о волосах, коже и т.д.) осыпаться, выпадать; пропускать (слова); (книжн.) возможно; (книжн.) если
tuō: (графема) убирать, избавляться от; покидать, выбираться из
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Horny teenager love to undress bodies.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " meat " and " dui ", the original meaning is skin and bones removed. "Book of Rites‧ Nei Ze": "The meat is said to be taken off."

"Erya·Shiqi": "The meat is to take it off." Guo Pu's note: "It is also to peel the skin." Xing Bingshu: "This argument is also to choose the name of the fish. The meat is peeled off, because the name is "Zhi". Li Xunyun: "To remove the meat from its bones is to take off."" "Shuowen": "Eliminate the meat. From the meat, match the sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Eliminate the meat. It’s too bad. Today’s proverb says that 𤸃 is too bad. It’s just like sloughing."

" Take off " can mean leave and get rid of. "Laozi": "The fish cannot escape from the abyss, and the weapon of the country cannot be shown to others."

" Off " may also represent escape. "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language 4": "Fear public, take advantage of the nap, and leave Qin Bo in the royal city." Wei Zhao's note: "Leave the meeting, escape, sneak away."

" Take off " also means to fall off or fall off. "Lao Tzu": "A good builder will not pull off, and a good hug will not take off."

"Take off " also means to take off (wear, hats, footwear, etc.). "Fables of Zhuangzi": "Get off the outdoors."

" Take off " also refers to vomiting or coming out. "Guan Zi·Ba Xing": "Speak out of your mouth, but order and do in the world." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Get out, go out."

" Off " can also mean simplicity. "Thirty-three Years of Zuo Zhuan‧ Gong Xi": "You are indifferent if you are inconsiderate, and if you are rude, you will get away." Du's note: "Get off, easy." Yang Bojun's note: "Get off, easy."

" Off " is also used as an adverb to indicate possibility or degree. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty·Li Tong Biography": "It is better to return to yourself. If things have not happened, take off to avoid disaster." "The Book of Southern Qi·Yuzhang Documents Wang Yi Biography": "Yangzhou governor has six white collars combined with fans, two white brushes, and the ministers take off If you are suspicious, why not try this?"

" Off " is also used as a conjunction to express hypothesis. "Wu Zi‧ Li Shi": "You try to send 50,000 people who have failed, and your ministers should rate them. You can't win, make fun of the princes, and lose power in the world."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " meat " and " dui ", the original meaning is skin and bones removed.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「兌」聲，本義為肉剝皮去骨。《禮記‧內則》：「肉曰脫之。」

　　《爾雅‧釋器》：「肉曰脫之。」郭璞注：「剝其皮也。」邢昺疏：「此論治擇魚肉之名也。肉剝去其皮，因名『脫之』。李巡云：『肉去其骨曰脫。』」《說文》：「消肉臞也。从肉，兌聲。」段玉裁注：「消肉臞也。消肉之臞，臞之甚者也。今俗語謂𤸃太甚者曰脫形。言其形象如解蛻也。」

　　「脫」可表示離開、擺脫。《老子》：「魚不可脫於淵，國之利器不可以示人。」

　　「脫」也可表示逃脫。《國語‧晉語四》：「公懼，乘馹自下，脫會秦伯於王城。」韋昭注：「脫會，遁行，潛走。」

　　「脫」還表示脫落、掉下。《老子》：「善建者不拔，善抱者不脫。」

　　「脫」亦表示脫掉(穿戴的衣帽鞋襪等物)。《莊子‧寓言》：「脫屨戶外。」

　　「脫」也指吐出、冒出。《管子‧霸行》：「言脫乎口，而令行乎天下。」尹知章注：「脫，出也。」

　　「脫」還能表示簡易。《左傳‧僖公三十三年》：「輕則寡謀，無禮則脫。」杜預注：「脫，易也。」楊伯峻注：「脫，簡易也。」

　　「脫」也用作副詞，表示可能性或程度。《後漢書‧李通傳》：「不如詣闕自歸。事既未然，脫可免禍。」 《南齊書‧豫章文獻王嶷傳》：「揚州刺史舊有六白領合扇，二白拂，臣脫以為疑，不審此當云何？」

　　「脫」還用作連詞，表示假設。《吳子‧勵士》：「君試發無功者五萬人，臣請率以當之。脫其不勝，取笑於諸侯，失權於天下矣。」
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，「兌」聲，本義為肉剝皮去骨。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
脫 (Simplified: 脱)
Pinyin: tuō
English Definition: to shed; to take off; to escape; to get away from
Antonyms: 穿
Total strokes: 11; Radical: 肉
Pictophonetic: 兌 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 兌 [ duì ] cash, check; to exchange
Example Words:
脫離 [ tuō lí ]: to separate oneself from; to break away from; diastasis (medicine); abscission; abjunction (botany)
脫貧致富 [ tuō pín zhì fù ]: to rise from poverty and become prosperous (idiom); poverty alleviation
脫穎而出 [ tuō yǐng ér chū ]: to reveal one's talent (idiom); to rise above others; to distinguish oneself
脫貧 [ tuō pín ]: to lift oneself out of poverty
More: 脫* | *脫 | *脫*

脱脱 		undress, escape

(Simplified: 脱)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 穿
Pictophonetic: 兌 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 兌 [ duì ] cash, check; to exchange
①離開，落掉：脫產。脫髮。脫節。脫離。脫落。脫貧(擺脫貧困)。脫稿(完成著作)。脫手。擺脫。掙脫。臨陣逃脫。
②遺漏：脫漏。脫誤。脫文(因抄刊古書而誤脫的字。亦稱“奪文”)。
③取下，除去：脫下。脫帽。脫氧。脫脂。脫胎換骨。
④倘若，或許：脫有不測。
⑤輕慢：脫略(放任，不拘束)。脫易(輕率，不講究禮貌)。輕脫(輕率，不持重，放蕩)。
⑥姓氏。

脫穎而出 [ tuō yǐng ér chū ]: to reveal one's talent (idiom); to rise above others; to distinguish oneself
脫貧 [ tuō pín ]: to lift oneself out of poverty

脫字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　脫； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页984第12
【唐韻】【韻會】【正韻】?徒活切，音奪。【說文】消肉臞也。【玉篇】肉去骨【韻會】一曰壤斷。【增韻】物自解也。【博雅】脫，離也。【爾雅·釋器】肉曰脫之。【註】剝其皮也。【疏】治肉，除其筋膜，取好者。　又【韻會】免也。【前漢·高五王傳】自以爲不得脫長安。【註】脫，免也。　又略也。【史記·禮書】凡禮始乎脫。【註】脫，猶疏略也。【後漢·向栩傳】及之官，時人謂其必當脫素從儉。【註】脫易?素。　又【博雅】脫，遺也。【禮·冠義知其能弟長而無遺矣註】遺，猶脫也。　又過去也。【莊子·天地篇】老子曰：夫巧知神聖之人，吾自以爲脫焉。【註】脫，過去也。　又除也。【公羊傳·昭十九年】復加一飯，則脫然愈。【註】脫然，疾除貌。　又【韻會】誤也。　又或然之辭。　又草名。【爾雅·釋草】倚商，活脫。【山海經】升山，其草多寇脫。【註】寇脫草生南方，高丈許，似荷葉，而莖中有瓤，正白。　又鳥名。【博雅】籠脫，鷂也。　又山名。【山海經】東七十里，曰脫扈之山。　又龍脫，地名。【史記·樊酈傳】

脫字的源字形

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体旧字形

暂无。
